Description: Fragment of a multicolour wool tapestry (single warp threads) panel (a) attached to two plain wool textiles (b & c); Central motif unclear but includes small green birds with roundels; Warp: S-spun, 13-14 tpc; Weft: S-spun, c.55 tpc; Edges all ragged: Sewing: S-spun Z ply wool thread in running stitch and conching attaches (a) to (c), and overcasting joins (a) to (b). (b) is a fragment of plain weave, undyed wool fabric; Warp: S-spun, c.14 tpc, Weft: S-spun, c.32 tpc; Edges: one selvedge, two warp cord and extra selvedge weft (several threads), other edges ragged. (c) also plain weave, undyed wool fabric; Warp: S-spun, c.13 tpc; Weft: S-spun, c.15tpc; Edges cut or ragged
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, brown box; Tapestry probably originally woven as part of a larger textile, sewing dates from repair and reuse; Information from Hero granger-Taylor (1.11.1990)
Condition: Poor; unknown date stuck to sticky net
